headline: Axon Tased By AI Software Fears As Investors Shoot First
summary: Axon stock has tumbled more than 30% in little over a week, and all the evidence indicates that the maker of Tasers, body cameras, drones and software for law enforcement has been victimized by Wall Street's freak-out over AI disrupting the software industry.  Initially, analysts scratched their heads over Axon's stock plunge that began on Jan. 28.  The sell-off started as a fight broke out in Washington over the Department of Homeland Security budget in the wake of the Jan. 24 killing of Alex Pretti by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers in Minneapolis.
